result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jade A. Weber-Marshak
Current: E2209 Spencer Lake Rd, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States  (Effective: 08-01-2017)
Prior: 208 1/2 Maple Street, Waupaca, WI 54981 United States

Defendant Jade A. Weber-Marshak in court with attorney Thomas W. Johnson. 
James H Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Statements by counsel. 
Court questions defendant. 
No contest plea entered to counts 1 & 2 in 15CM255. 
Court accepts plea after rights were explained and Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed. 
State has complied with victim notifications. 
Court accepts agreement and finds guilty of counts 1 & 2. 
15CM422 is dismissed and read in. 
Restitution summary and victim impact statement filed with the Court. 
Sentence recommendations by counsel. 
Statements by the defendant to the Court. 
Court reviews victim impact statement. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 18 months probation, each count concurrent. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- pay restitution and surcharge, joint & several with Brandon Bellile 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- 45 days jail, stayed, to be used at Agent's discretion 
- expungement upon successful completion of Probation 
- may discharge early after 1 year, if Agent is satisfied and sends written request to the Court 
Advised of appeal rights.
Status conference on April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Request by Atty. Johnson to reschedule, DA's office no objection
